meanings.definition: Administering the Christian rite of baptism to someone.
meanings.sent1: The priest was baptising the baby in the church.
meanings.sent2: The pastor will be baptising new members next Sunday.
meanings.sent3: The ducks were baptising each other in the pond, pretending to be priests.
meanings.sent4: The rain was baptising the earth, bringing new life to the fields.
meanings.sent5: The sun baptising the world in its warm light every morning.

meanings.definition: Immersing in water as a religious rite.
meanings.sent1: She was baptising the new believers in the river.
meanings.sent2: The crowd cheered as the priest began baptising the followers.
meanings.sent3: The kids were baptising each other in the pool, splashing water everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The storm was baptising the town in heavy rain, cleansing the streets.
meanings.sent5: The ocean baptising the surfers in its salty embrace.

meanings.definition: Initiating or dedicating someone to a new experience or belief.
meanings.sent1: The mentor was baptising the apprentice into the art of painting.
meanings.sent2: The professor was baptising the students into the world of literature.
meanings.sent3: The friends were baptising their buddy into the world of gaming, teaching him the basics.
meanings.sent4: The challenge was baptising her into a new level of determination and perseverance.
meanings.sent5: The adventure baptising him into a world of excitement and unknown possibilities.
